column5: Is ther a way to purchase a licence on the internet? It would be nice to have one early.

Non-Canadian resident fishing licences are also available through the mail by calling the Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources at 1-800-667-1940.or How can I get more information about the Outdoors Card?The staff at the Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources' Outdoors Card Centre would be pleased to answer your questions.You may reach the Outdoors Card Centre (toll free) at 1-800-387-7011 from anywhere in North America.The hours of operation of the Outdoors Card Centre are Monday to Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. (Eastern Time).Good Fishin'Dan

I already called fishing minestry, they told me you can purchase license and outdoors card over phone.( they only take payment of a credit card ) they also said you can purchase your license and outdoors at the sporting goods stores. No internet yet!!! Good luck in canada
Here is a place in Windsor that will sell you one on the web: http://www.wallysbait.com/products.asp?cat=28. I have bought mine from there the past couple of years. BOB
downriverbob Do you know how much the charge for the service of purchasing your license via the internet?
It think it is $6.00 per purchase, living south of Detroit I get them in a couple of days. They come across to Detroit once a week Thursdays and mail the licenses to people in the U.S. BOB
